results.title: The Thieving magpie = La Gazza ladra
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts, Emanuele Luzzati and Giulio Gianini
results.brief_description: An Italian cartoon based on an original fairy tale, inspired by Rossini’s lively overture, La Gazza Ladra (The Thieving Magpie), and by the personality of a pet magpie that had lived in the Gianini home for many years. The cartoon depicts a pageant of medieval knights whose grand procession is reduced to havoc by one insolent bird who would rather steal crowns than dodge arrows. No commentary, music only.

results.title: The Thief of Baghdad
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Douglas Fairbanks and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: Douglas Fairbanks plays the part of the Thief of Bagdad. He tries to win the heart of his true love, the Caliph’s daughter, by competing with various Princes to find rare treasure.

constellations_other.name: Right on cue
constellations_other.description: In the silent film era, cue sheets charted major moments of a film, along with recommended audio accompaniment matching the action on screen.

results.creator_credit_for_label: United Artists Corporation, Douglas Fairbanks and Raoul Walsh
results.description: Douglas Fairbanks plays the part of the Thief of Bagdad. He tries to win the heart of his true love, the Caliph’s daughter, by competing with various Princes to find rare treasure. He climbs clouds, battles sea-creatures and killer plants, defeats the Mongols with an army of dust, rides a winged horse and finally becomes victorious. This silent classic is a much loved children’s film.

results.title: The Thief = Bop = Vor
results.creator_credit: NTV-Profit, Le Pont, Roissy Films, Igor Tolstunov and Pavel Ciukhrai
results.brief_description: A young widower and her son travel aboard a crowded train in post-war Russia. A chance encounter with a soldier changes their lives irrevocably, as the widower takes the soldier as her lover, who insists that her son, Sanja, call him daddy. Sanja is initially tormented by conflicting emotions, as he still dreams of his soldier father who died before Sanya was born. He is also drawn to the tough, cynical, patriotic, yet ultimately thieving “new” father. To confound matters Sanja is driven by an Oedipal force, and resents the time that his mother’s new lover has taken from him. Sanya, his mother, and new lover lead a dangerous existence, with the lover, Tolyan gaining the trust of his comrades, stealing from them, then disappearing and repeating the deception elsewhere. Sanja’s mother decides to leave their life of crime but Tolyan is captured and imprisoned as they prepare to leave. As his mother grows gravely ill, Sanya realises he is alone in the world and his loyalties shift as Tolyan becomes the father he now pursues. Cast includes Vladimir Mashkov, Yekaterina Rednikova and Misha Philipchuk. In Russian with English sub titles.

results.title: The Thermal wilderness (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Illustrates the necessary precautions to be taken when hiking in hot and heat-wave conditions. Shows ways to avoid complications due to salt depletion, heat cramp, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the basic tgreatment for these conditions.
Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Themes of Macbeth
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John Barnes and Douglas Campbell
results.brief_description: Studies how the play Macbeth is built on the paradox. “Nothing is but what is not”. Explains that the world of Macbeth is one in which appearances cannot be trusted. Narrated by Douglas Campbell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John Barnes and Douglas Campbell

results.title: The Thames: Royal Windsor to Tilbury
results.creator_credit: John C. Walker and Millicent Walker
results.brief_description: The River Thames has been called “England’s liquid history”. It starts in the Cotswold Hills and winds for over 160 miles, through nine English counties until it reaches London. In the journey downstream, beginning at Windsor Castle, Eton, Datchet, Staines, Walton-on-Thames, Hampton Court Palace, Richmond Hill, Kew Gardens, and so on to London, and Battersea Park, the Tate Gallery, Lambeth Palace, the Houses of Parliament, Tower Bridge, Greenwich and finally, Tilbury Docks are shown.

results.title: The Textile touch
results.creator_credit: McCurdy-Bursell Films, Cyril Bursell and Jim McCurdy
results.brief_description: Macrame, rug-hooking and loom weaving are three rewarding techniques of expressing creativity with textiles. The film gives art students a solid introduction to these textile techniques and encourages them towards freedom from the constraints of traditional designs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McCurdy-Bursell Films, Cyril Bursell and Jim McCurdy

results.title: The Texas chainsaw massacre = The Texas chain saw massacre
results.brief_description: Loosely based on the grizzly exploits of American serial killer Ed Gein (also a model for Norman Bates in “Psycho”), Tobe Hooper’s “The Texas chain saw massacre” rightly deserves its place as a horror classic. Five teenagers travelling through Texas (two of them brother and sister investigating the mysterious desecration of their grandfather’s grave), pick up a creepy hitchhiker and find themselves embroiled in a macabre and nightmarish reverse of southern hospitality. From its eerie opening images to its shocking finale, “The Texas chain saw massacre’ was initially considered a cheap drive-in exploitation film but, through strong critical appraisal, went on to be screened as part of the director’s fortnight at Cannes and the American Museum of Modern Art now has a print of it in its permanent collection. Cast includes Marilyn Burns, Allen Danziger and Gunnar Hansen as Leatherface. Please note: special features are contained on disk two.
